title: HELP!!! Does anyone know what font this is?
author: Mike palmer

comments.content: I can't see anything. It would also be nice if you could be more specific with the title of your thread, if you read down you will see just how many threads have variations on this...
Is it the bold version of it? Because that doesnt seem to be the one

The Bitstream version of Albertus, [Flareserif 821](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/flareserif-821/bold/) has a bold weight. I'm not sure if any of the other versions do.

- Lex

The bold weight of Flareserif 821 is closer, but it still isn't heavy enough.

[Hewlett-Packard](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060601/http:/www.hp.com/) used to ship an Albertus Extra Bold with their LaserJet printers (maybe they still do). I have still have a copy of this font, and it looks like an exact match to me.

A newer laser printer of mine, a [Brother](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060601/http:/www.brother.com/), came with something called Alaska Extrabold that also looks like a match.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060601im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Cuba-Fruit-Mart_comparison_6057.png)

From top to bottom:

1. Original sample posted by Mike Palmer
2. Albertus Extra Bold (HP)
3. Alaska Extrabold (Brother)

I think HP's Albertus Extra Bold is an exact match. (Small differences are due to artifacts introduced by Photoshop's anti-aliasing.)

Brother's Alaska Extrabold: Close, but no cigar.
Thank you so much for your help. I couldnt find a match at all. Again thank you so much...You guys rock
